sentence:
The interviews and study sessions were conducted by trained clinical psychologists and based on manuals outlining study procedures and instructions for participants.Smartphone Intervention
During the training, participants completed four phases (Figure 1): (1) the preparatory phase, (2) the depressed mood induction phase, (3) the first training phase, and (4) the second training phase.

Psychology students at FAU could alternatively receive course credits.Results
Feasibility of the Intervention
The study flow is displayed in Figure 2.

Technical difficulties with the EmpkinS-EKSpression app occurred in 2 training sessions: one of them had to be terminated immediately after the start due to an error in the app, leading to the drop-out of that participant (Figure 2).

Descriptively, there was a visible mood change after the negative mood induction (ie, an increase in depressed mood, and a decrease in positive mood) and an increase in positive mood after each trial, particularly during the first training phase (Figure 3).

The R code for creating Figure 3 was partially generated using ChatGPT (ChatGPT v2; OpenAI).Abbreviations

AAMT
approach-avoidance modification training
AFE
antidepressive facial expression
CBT
cognitive behavioral therapy
CR
cognitive reappraisal
EMG
electromyography
EmpkinS
Empatho-Kinaesthetic Sensor Technology
FAU
Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg
GRID-HAMD
GRID Hamilton Depression Rating Scale
ICS
interacting cognitive subsystems
PHQ
Patient Health Questionnaire
RCT
randomized controlled trial
SCID-5-CV
Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-5 Disorders–Clinician version
UEQ-S
Short Version of the User Experience Questionnaire
Multimedia Appendix 1
American Psychological Association journal article reporting standards.

formative_v9i1e65357_app1.pdf (1MB, pdf) 
Multimedia Appendix 2
Self-developed items to assess usability and acceptability.

formative_v9i1e65357_app2.docx (41.5KB, docx) 
Data Availability
The data sets analyzed during this study and the analysis code are available in the Open Science Framework [48].Footnotes
Conflicts of Interest: None declared.References

1.GBD 2019 Mental Disorders Collaborators  Global, regional, and national burden of 12 mental disorders in 204 countries and territories, 1990-2019: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2019.

The interviews and study sessions were conducted by trained clinical psychologists and based on manuals outlining study procedures and instructions for participants.Smartphone Intervention
During the training, participants completed four phases (Figure 1): (1) the preparatory phase, (2) the depressed mood induction phase, (3) the first training phase, and (4) the second training phase.

Smartphone Intervention
During the training, participants completed four phases (Figure 1): (1) the preparatory phase, (2) the depressed mood induction phase, (3) the first training phase, and (4) the second training phase.
During the training, participants completed four phases (Figure 1): (1) the preparatory phase, (2) the depressed mood induction phase, (3) the first training phase, and (4) the second training phase.

Results
Feasibility of the Intervention
The study flow is displayed in Figure 2.

Technical difficulties with the EmpkinS-EKSpression app occurred in 2 training sessions: one of them had to be terminated immediately after the start due to an error in the app, leading to the drop-out of that participant (Figure 2).

Descriptively, there was a visible mood change after the negative mood induction (ie, an increase in depressed mood, and a decrease in positive mood) and an increase in positive mood after each trial, particularly during the first training phase (Figure 3).

Descriptively, there was a visible mood change after the negative mood induction (ie, an increase in depressed mood, and a decrease in positive mood) and an increase in positive mood after each trial, particularly during the first training phase (Figure 3).
